Disclosure Statement
(Ex.PW26/J)
Ocular Evidence of PWs
As per the disclosure statement,
Sushil was repaying the loan
amount taken from Tikla (PW-9)
with interest @5% per month.
As per Tikla (PW-9), Sushil was
repaying the loan amount with
interest @2% per month (pg
171).
On 22 nd February, 2009, Tikla is
stated to have come again at
Chintoo car point to collect the
loan amount accompanied by
15-20 persons in several cars.
Whereas evidence has been led
that only two cars had come, an
Esteem in which Tikla had
come alongwith his associates
Sudhir, Hemant and Gajender;
and a black Santro in which
PWs
Sunil,
Paramjeet,
Surender, Varun, deceased
Ankit had come.
It was also stated in the
disclosure
that
on
22 nd
February, 2009 Tikla had gone
out of the office dissatisfied,
abusing and threatening Sushil
after the latter asked for further
2-3 months time to repay the
balance amount.
Whereas as per Tikla and other
witnesses, the talks had ended
in a settlement on the 22 nd
February, 2009.
On hearing a commotion at the
parking lot outside, all three
(Sushil himself, his elder
brother Pushkar and Rajesh
Pandey) came out of the office.
But as per Prosecution and the
other witnesses, after the talks,
only Tikla and his associates
had come out of the office.
Reliance is made to a scuffle
between Varun and/or Ankit
from Tikla's side and 2/3
persons over moving out of
vehicle
in
which
Tikla
intervened and separated.
As per the disclosure, on coming
out, Sushil saw Tikla's people
badly beating Vishnu, Hemant
and Sonveer.
Sushil stated to have been
sitting in the rear middle seat of
the Indica Car.
Whereas, as per PW1 Sunil,
Sushil was seated at the rear
extreme right seat behind the
driver's seat.
Sushil then stated that all five of
them had got out of the Indica
near the Budha garden gate
and immediately sat inside
again.
None of the prosecution
witnesses support this theory
(including PW-2 Manveer), It is
only in Ranjit (PW-4's)
dubious testimony that all the
occupants of the Indica had
gotten
down
and
had
"hurriedly reoccupied their
Indica Car."
